Class TaskTimeLine

java.lang.Object
userInterface.backEnd.TaskTimeLine
public class TaskTimeLine extends Object
Timeline renderer for a single Task used by the back-end visualization.

A TaskTimeLine draws one horizontal band per task where execution-related intervals (EXECUTION, WAIT, CONTEXTSWITCH, MIGRATION, WRONG) are rendered as colored rectangles. The origin point o ("時間軸起始位置") defines the start of the time axis. When the parent viewer is in multi-core mode, a secondary "Core" lane is rendered beneath the task band to show the core ID associated with each interval.

Integrated behavior from inline comments:

  • Draws time axes and tick marks (畫時間軸/畫時間軸刻度), labeling fewer ticks when zoomed out to reduce clutter.
  • Calls drawPeriod(Graphics) to render period and relative deadline markers for the task.
  • Uses a predefined HSB color palette to draw core or resource segments and reverseColor(Color) for contrasting text.
  • Labels fractional start/end times using two-decimal formatting when the first decimal digit is non-zero.
Author:
ShiuJia

    Creates an empty timeline; callers typically use the parameterized constructor to set parent, position and task ID.

    Constructs a task timeline bound to a ScheduleResult, assigns a numeric ID and computes its vertical origin based on the parent's task gap.

  • Constructor Details

    • TaskTimeLine

      public TaskTimeLine()
      Creates an empty timeline; callers typically use the parameterized constructor to set parent, position and task ID.

    • TaskTimeLine

      public TaskTimeLine(ScheduleResult sr, int i, String id)
      Constructs a task timeline bound to a ScheduleResult, assigns a numeric ID and computes its vertical origin based on the parent's task gap.
      Parameters:
      sr - the owning schedule result used for scale and data access
      i - zero-based vertical index of this task band
      id - textual task identifier (parsed to integer and stored in ID)
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - if id cannot be parsed as an integer

  • Method Details

    • addExecution

      public void addExecution(TaskExecution te)
      Appends an execution-related segment to this task's timeline. Integrates the inline note (E, X 狀態) to indicate typical usage for EXECUTION and other statuses.
      Parameters:
      te - the execution segment to add

    • drawItself

      public void drawItself(Graphics g)
      Paints the complete task timeline onto the given Graphics context.

      Steps:

      1. Draw the secondary "Core" lane when in multi-core mode (with arrow ends and tick marks).
      2. Draw the main time axis for the task band (with arrow ends).
      3. Render period/deadline markers via drawPeriod(Graphics).
      4. Render tick marks and numeric labels; label density depends on parent scale to avoid clutter.
      5. For each TaskExecution, draw a rectangle depending on Definition.CoreStatus: MIGRATION (blue, half height), CONTEXTSWITCH (light gray, half height), WAIT (filled), WRONG (red 'X'), EXECUTION (outlined). When multi-core, also draw a small bar in the core lane tinted by core ID and optionally print the core ID. Fractional start/end timestamps are labeled when significant.
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics context to draw into

    • drawPeriod

      public void drawPeriod(Graphics g)
      Draws period start markers (triangles) and relative deadline markers for the task across the timeline using the parent's data setting. Period and deadline values are converted from simulator time using the magnification factor.
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics context to draw into

    • drawResources

      public void drawResources(TimeLineResult rv)
      Adds resource panels (one per locked resource within an EXECUTION segment) to the provided TimeLineResult container and positions them. These panels are standard Swing components that will be painted by the UI.
      Parameters:
      rv - the timeline container which hosts resource panels

    • reDrawResources

      public void reDrawResources(TimeLineResult rv, Graphics g)
      Repositions resource panels and immediately paints their rectangles and labels using the supplied graphics context. Colors are selected from resourceColor by resource set ID; text color is inverted with reverseColor(Color) for readability inside narrow bars.
      Parameters:
      rv - the timeline container holding resource panels
      g - graphics context used for immediate painting

    • reverseColor

      public Color reverseColor(Color color)
      Produces a contrasting color by inverting the RGB channels of the given color (simple 255 - component inversion) to ensure readable text over filled rectangles.
      Parameters:
      color - the original color
      Returns:
      inverted color for drawing text or outlines

    • getExecutionNumber

      public int getExecutionNumber()
      Returns the number of recorded execution segments in this timeline.
      Returns:
      execution segment count
